segments.source_content:
---
slug: /143
title: "This Week In React #143: RSC Quiz, useFormStatus, Next.js Website, Panda CSS, useLayoutEffect, Million.js, Immer, Super Apps, React-Three-Fiber, Vite..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 04-25-2023
---
We have a lot of great React articles this week, but also some nice releases. I liked the breakdown of the animations on the new Next.js website, and the discovery of the new Panda CSS library.

translations.fr: Nous avons beaucoup d'excellents articles React cette semaine, mais aussi de belles sorties. J'ai apprÃ©ciÃ© l'analyse dÃ©taillÃ©e des animations sur le nouveau site Next.js et la dÃ©couverte de la nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que Panda CSS.

translations.fr: **[React-admin - Le Framework Open-Source pour les applications B2B](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react)**

segments.source_content: Are you currently building an admin panel with React? If so, we have some exciting news for you! By using React-admin, an open-source framework for B2B apps, you can spare yourself days of coding! ğŸ¤©

translations.fr: ÃŠtes-vous en train de construire un panneau d'administration avec React ? Si oui, nous avons des nouvelles passionnantes pour vous ! En utilisant React-admin, un framework open-source pour les applications B2B, vous pouvez vous Ã©pargner des jours de codage ! ğŸ¤©
translations.en: ÃŠtes-vous en train de dÃ©velopper un panneau d'administration avec React ? Si oui, nous avons d'excellentes nouvelles pour vous ! En utilisant React-admin, un framework open-source pour applications B2B, vous pouvez vous Ã©pargner des jours de codage ! ğŸ¤©

segments.source_content: With React-admin you can not only save valuable time, but you can also become a better developer! You don't have to take only our word for it, though. There are already over 20,000 developers who use it daily and swear by its effectiveness. And if you're curious about the experiences of developers who have used React-admin for years already, check out NPO [Caritas' testimonial](https://marmelab.com/blog/2022/07/07/react-admin-caritas.html).

Ne vous fiez pas uniquement Ã  notre parole : plus de 20 000 dÃ©veloppeurs l'utilisent quotidiennement et attestent de son efficacitÃ©. Si vous Ãªtes curieux des retours d'expÃ©rience, consultez le tÃ©moignage de l'ONG [Caritas](https://marmelab.com/blog/2022/07/07/react-admin-caritas.html).

segments.source_content: Join our thriving community as well as [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/jR3D6SdQ) server, so you can stay up-to-date on the latest React-admin updates and get support from a network of experienced developers.

segments.source_content: You may have noticed the [new Nextjs.org landing page](https://nextjs.org/)? Rauno works at Vercel and deconstructs the UI subtleties of this page. Personally I love their gradient tracing technique! Interesting React implementation and great result.

translations.fr: Avez-vous remarquÃ© la [nouvelle page d'accueil de Nextjs.org](https://nextjs.org/) ? Rauno travaille chez Vercel et dÃ©cortique les subtilitÃ©s de l'interface utilisateur de cette page. Personnellement, j'adore leur technique de tracÃ© de dÃ©gradÃ© ! Une implÃ©mentation React intÃ©ressante et un excellent rÃ©sultat.
translations.en: Vous avez peut-Ãªtre remarquÃ© la [nouvelle page d'accueil de Nextjs.org](https://nextjs.org/) ? Rauno travaille chez Vercel et dÃ©cortique les subtilitÃ©s de l'interface utilisateur de cette page. Personnellement, j'adore leur technique de tracÃ© de dÃ©gradÃ© ! Une implÃ©mentation React intÃ©ressante et un excellent rÃ©sultat.
[![Panda CSS â€“ CSS-in-JS sans surcharge Ã  l'exÃ©cution](/emails/issues/143/panda.jpg)](https://infinum.com/blog/panda-css-css-in-js-without-runtime-overhead/)
**[Panda CSS â€“ CSS-in-JS sans surcharge Ã  l'exÃ©cution](https://infinum.com/blog/panda-css-css-in-js-without-runtime-overhead/)**

segments.source_content: Panda CSS is a new zero-runtime CSS-in-JS library under development for [the future of Chakra UI](https://www.adebayosegun.com/blog/the-future-of-chakra-ui). The Panda doc is not yet available, but this article gives a first pragmatic overview in a Next.js context.

translations.fr: Panda CSS est une nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que CSS-in-JS sans runtime en cours de dÃ©veloppement pour [l'avenir de Chakra UI](https://www.adebayosegun.com/blog/the-future-of-chakra-ui). La documentation de Panda n'est pas encore disponible, mais cet article donne un premier aperÃ§u pragmatique dans un contexte Next.js.
translations.en: Panda CSS est une nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que CSS-in-JS sans runtime en cours de dÃ©veloppement pour [l'avenir de Chakra UI](https://www.adebayosegun.com/blog/the-future-of-chakra-ui). La documentation de Panda n'est pas encore disponible, mais cet article offre une premiÃ¨re vue pragmatique dans un contexte Next.js.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘¥ New wave of layoffs at Meta that also affects open-source tech profiles of our community, including [Mengdi Chen](https://twitter.com/mengdi_en/status/1648718077796786177) (React DevTools), [Robert Balicky](https://twitter.com/StatisticsFTW/status/1648820621252653056) (Relay), [Matt Carroll](https://twitter.com/mattcarrollcode/status/1648770402272018432) (DevRel React, looking for a new job) and [Sean Keegan](https://twitter.com/DevRelSean/status/1649466893806215172) (DevRel React, looking for a new job). Feel free to reach out to those who are looking for a new opportunity.
- ğŸ‘€ [React PR - experimental_useFormStatus](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1651135782990561280): a new hook `useFormState()` could arrive in React, whose signature is [inspired by Remix](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1651191679943049216) `useNavigation()`.
- ğŸ‘€ [React.dev translation update](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1649575563055493120): the translation repositories of the new doc are up to date. It is possible to start translating the new document.
- ğŸ§µ [Dan Abramov's RSC Quiz](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1648923232937058304): a very interesting thread that could help you to have a better intuition on how Server Components work.
- ğŸ§µ [Dan Abramov on the origins / inspirations of React Server Components (PHP/Hack/XHP)](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1648830869304426500)
- ğŸ§µ [useLayoutEffect + queueMicrotask](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1650829494209466373): my tip got more interest than I thought ğŸ˜„
- ğŸ¦ [Dan Abramov on using Preact Signals](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1650892432119148546): this patches React, which can not guarantee its proper functioning if you decide to use it.
- ğŸ“œ [Why You Don't Need Signals in React](https://blog.axlight.com/posts/why-you-dont-need-signals-in-react/): Daishi explained that signals are characterized by 2 elements: responsiveness, and diffing bypassing. He proposes to use Jotai for reactivity, and not to try to bypass diffing.
- ğŸ“œ [Creative ways of using useReducer](https://www.code-insights.dev/posts/creative-ways-of-using-usereducer): highlights 4 original ways to use `useReducer`: toggle, increment, state formatting and state merge.
- ğŸ“œ [Where to host your Remix app in 2023](https://www.jacobparis.com/guides/where-to-host-remix): good analysis with a comparative matrix to choose your host.
- ğŸ“œ [Securing your Next.js 13 application](https://www.yagiz.co/securing-your-nextjs-13-application): shows how to secure its Next.js app with headers, and proposes a detailed implementation for CSRF.
- ğŸ“œ [Can Rust Beat Javascript in 2023?](https://joshuamo876.bearblog.dev/can-rust-beat-javascript-in-2023/): Web frameworks based on Rust and WebAssembly have progressed well in benchmarks. This also shows that they have a fairly similar model to React.
- ğŸ“œ [Say no to "flickering" UI: useLayoutEffect, painting and browsers story](https://www.developerway.com/posts/no-more-flickering-ui): implements a responsive navigation menu, and explains how a synchronous `useLayoutEffect` can fix a visual glitch of the 1st rendering. For SSR, it's not that simple!
- ğŸ“œ [Display a view counter on your blog with React Server Components](https://scastiel.dev/view-counter-react-server-components): replace SWR with RSC to display a view counter. Adding a Suspense around the counter allows not to block the rendering.
- ğŸ“œ [How we built the Storybook Day 3D animation](https://varun.ca/storybook-day/): explanations on how to create a 3D scene with React-Three-Fiber.
- ğŸ“œ [Storybook Community Showcase 5](https://storybook.js.org/blog/community-showcase-5/)
- ğŸ“œ [The Evolution of React Rendering Architectures & Web Performance](https://www.iamtk.co/the-evolution-of-react-rendering-architectures-and-web-performance)
- ğŸ“œ [Integrating React Flow and the Web Audio API](https://reactflow.dev/blog/react-flow-and-the-web-audio-api/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Vite 4.3](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite4-3.html): big performance improvements on a benchmark with 1000 React components.
- ğŸ“¦ [Redux Toolkit v2.0.0 alpha.5](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/releases/tag/v2.0.0-alpha.5): new `combineSlices` API to lazy-load reducers.
- ğŸ“¦ [T3 Env](https://env.t3.gg/): new solution to parse environment variables with Zod, with Next.js integration.
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Three-Offscreen](https://github.com/pmndrs/react-three-offscreen): allows React-Three-Fiber 3D rendering in a web worker via an OffscreenCanvas, to avoid blocking the main thread.
- ğŸ“¦ [Million.js 2.3.0](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1650406345517199361): Next.js support and optimizer Forgetti integration. A new package [Hundred.js](https://twitter.com/aidenybai/status/1651072640650727424) to understand how the block-based virtual DOM works.
- ğŸ“¦ [Immer 10.0](https://github.com/immerjs/immer/releases/tag/v10.0.0): faster, smaller.
- ğŸ“¦ [Lingui 4.0](https://github.com/lingui/js-lingui/releases/tag/v4.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Micro Frontends Next Generation - A React Server Components Playground](https://github.com/unstubbable/mfng)
- ğŸ“¦ [Simple RSC, Deno Edition](https://github.com/itsMapleLeaf/simple-rsc-deno)
- ğŸ¥ [Next.js Image Component Just Got Way Better](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow3VsOJcvpM): show the advantages of using Cloudinary in a Next.js app. I take the opportunity to thank James for the [newsletter shoutout](https://www.youtube.com/clip/UgkxZ3ySVUr0oCmNn_VQcBJGOFPdSG2V_h3h) ğŸ¤—.
- ğŸ¥ [React and TypeScript Stopped Fighting?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sr8bwLXDm3U)
- ğŸ¥ [How To Fix NextJS 13's N+1 Problem](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FfHsIio4aCU)

segments.source_content: Or run Â `npx create-tina-app@latest`Â then visit `localhost:3000/admin`

Callstack published a great resource on Super Apps, which allow to assemble several mini apps under a single mobile interface. They describe the business and organizational benefits as well as the possible technical solutions, and highlight their preferred solution: Re.Pack and Module Federation. There is also a repo [Super App Showcase](https://github.com/callstack/super-app-showcase) with an example Super App to study.

Ils dÃ©crivent les avantages commerciaux et organisationnels ainsi que les solutions techniques possibles, et mettent en avant leur solution prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©e : Re.Pack et Module Federation. Il existe Ã©galement un dÃ©pÃ´t [Super App Showcase](https://github.com/callstack/super-app-showcase) avec un exemple de Super App Ã  Ã©tudier.

Ils dÃ©crivent les avantages commerciaux et organisationnels ainsi que les solutions techniques possibles, et mettent en avant leur solution prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©e : Re.Pack et Module Federation. Il y a Ã©galement un dÃ©pÃ´t [Super App Showcase](https://github.com/callstack/super-app-showcase) avec un exemple de Super App Ã  Ã©tudier.

segments.source_content: Super Apps are popular in Asia (WeChat, MoMo...) but are gaining momentum. My intuition tells me that the [PlayStation 5 UI could be a React-Native Super App](https://twitter.com/syke/status/1619413099861413889), to be confirmed!

translations.fr: Les Super Apps sont populaires en Asie (WeChat, MoMo...) mais gagnent en popularitÃ©. Mon intuition me dit que [l'interface utilisateur de la PlayStation 5 pourrait Ãªtre une Super App React-Native](https://twitter.com/syke/status/1619413099861413889), Ã  confirmer !
translations.en: Les Super Apps sont populaires en Asie (WeChat, MoMo...) mais gagnent du terrain. Mon intuition me dit que [l'interface utilisateur de la PlayStation 5 pourrait Ãªtre une Super App React-Native](https://twitter.com/syke/status/1619413099861413889), Ã  confirmer !

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ‘¤ [Mark Lawlor (NativeWind) joins Expo](https://twitter.com/mark__lawlor/status/1648834143659384832): good news for the community, one more dev to work on the web/cross-platform support.
- ğŸ‘€ [Bluesky - Universal Expo app](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1650608419135700993): we have Twitter and its new competitor Bluesky [both using React-Native-Web](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1650488087430963204).
- ğŸ’¬ [RFC: Support Expo Config Plugins in React Native apps](https://twitter.com/TMisiukiewicz/status/1649050245106659330): proposes to upstream Expo Config Plugins directly into React-Native core for various DX reasons, including making upgrades easier. Proposal [challenged by Brent Vatne](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/pull/637#issuecomment-1518083817) and the community as it is not that hard to add Config Plugin / Prebuild support to an existing React-Native project.
- ğŸ“œ [Using AI to Write Tests for React Components](https://www.callstack.com/blog/using-ai-to-write-tests-for-react-components)

- ğŸ‘¥ [App.js](https://appjs.co/) (Krakow, May 10-12) is offering us [-20% on workshops](https://ti.to/appjs/2023/discount/ThisWeekinReact20) (code "ThisWeekinReact20").
- ğŸ‘¥ [Chain React](https://chainreactconf.com/) (Portland, May 18-19) is offering us -10% on entries (code "thisweekinreact").
- ğŸ‘¥ [React-Native-Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) (Paris, 1er June) is offering us -10% on entries (code "REACTHEBDO").

segments.source_content: Passionfroot's mission is to empower the independent businesses of tomorrow via YouTube, Podcasts, Social Media, and Newsletters. Join us in building a tool that will empower creators globally to build scalable, sustainable businesses.

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

translations.fr: Voulez-vous travailler sur les applications les plus utilisÃ©es au monde ? Souhaitez-vous co-crÃ©er la technologie React Native ? Rejoignez l'Ã©quipe Callstack de leaders React & React Native. Consultez notre site pour plus de dÃ©tails. Nous attendons votre candidature - montrez-nous ce que vous savez faire !

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) pour en savoir plus et n'oubliez pas de mentionner This Week in React.
